titleStmt.title: Taxonomy for Concepts defined in the Thesaurus Linguae Sericae

sourceDesc.p: Compiled from the implicit structure of linked concepts. Unfortunately, it seems that their are circular or inverse mappings, maybe due to a confusion between hypernym and hyponym

category.def: [NO HYPERNYM.] WHAT one CAN NAME:refer to.
OBJECT which COMBINES with OTHER OBJECTS to BECOME ONE LARGER WHOLE OBJECT.
LOWEST AND/OR MOST IMPORTANT PART of something.
BASED on PERCEIVING AND NOT ONLY BASED on REPORTS.
PART of an ARTEFACT or THING that is MOST LOW.
EQUAL PART of TWO PARTS of ONE THING.
ONE PART of THREE
PART of SPACE that THINGS BE-IN:are-in.
PLACE on the MORE DISTANT SIDE of a THING as SEEN FROM the HUMAN WHO SEES THIS THING.
IMMEDIATELY BEHIND a SEQUENCE of THINGS.
PLACE that is LOW IN-RELATION-TO something OTHER.
RELATION of one PLACE to TWO PLACES IN EXACTLY CONTRARY DIRECTIONS, OR the PLACE that has THESE RELATIONS.
BIG PLACE that CONTAINS MANY STREETS AND GOVERNMENT BUILDINGS, AND where INTENSELY MANY PEOPLE LIVE NEAR TOGETHER.
PROPER NAME of the cities of ancient China.
CITY where the GOVERNMENT of a STATE BE-IN:is located.
PLACE where EDGES OR SIDES of something MEET.
PLACE BETWEEN HOUSES LACKING BUILDINGS.
PLACE in SPACE CONTAINING the SUN, the MOON and the STARS.
PLACE BETWEEN SPEAKER AND something OR NEAR in the DIRECTION the SPEAKER LOOKING.
PLACE which BE-IN:is-in ANOTHER MORE BIG PLACE.
PLACE where an ARMY DWELLS.
PLACE where a BIRD LIVES, SLEEPS AND REARS its OFFSPRING.
The PLACE OUTSIDE BUILDINGS.
LONG AND NARROW LEVEL PLACE ON which HUMANS GO TO PLACES OR TRAVEL TO DISTANT PLACES.
WAY INSIDE a BUILDING THROUGH which to WALK FROM ONE ROOM TO ANOTHER.
SHALLOW WAY ACROSS a RIVER.
SMALL WAY.
WAY INSIDE a CITY OR VILLAGE.
WAY BELOW the SURFACE of the EARTH in the form of a BIG TUBE.
PLACE to the LEFT OR RIGHT, AND NOT IN FRONT OR BEHIND.
SHARP SIDE OR TIP FOR PIERCING OR CUTTING in a CUTTING TOOL.
SIDE of a RIVER, LAKE, OR SEA.
PLACE INSIDE DEFINED BOUNDARIES.
SMALL TERRITORY to be TILLED by DEFINED PEASANTS
SMALL FIELD CONTAINING FLOWERS, FRUIT TREES AND VEGETABLES ETC. FOR HOME USE.
FIELD IN which DOMESTIC ANIMALS EAT GRASS.
TERRITORY CONTAINING MANY TREES AND SHRUBS EVERYWHERE.
TERRITORY SURROUNDED by WATER on ALL SIDES
LARGE TERRITORY of TERRITORIES.
INTENSELY LARGE REGION OR PART of the WORLD.
SUPERNATURAL REGION IN the SKY.
GARDEN OF PERFECT HAPPINESS.
TERRITORY GOVERNED by an INDEPENDENT RULER.[[STAAT]]
MOST LARGE STATE in East Asia. [GEOGRPAHY]
An individual STATE, names of major states in the Warring States period.
STATE THOUGHT of an ABSTRACT INSTITUTION.
STATE ESTABLISHED by FREE DECISION by the LEADERS of its PARTS.
STATE WHERE ONE HAS ONE'S HOME.
STATE LACKING A KING OR HEREDITARY RULER
STATE in which the FREEDOMS AND the ACTS of GOVERNMENT are LIMITED by OR BASED on LAW.
VERY LARGE STATE CONTROLLING SEVERAL SMALL STATES
FEATURES of TERRITORY.
LANDSCAPE OUTSIDE CITIES AND SUBURBS.
LOW INTENSELY WET LANDSCAPE.
LOW LANDSCAPE BETWEEN NEAR MOUNTAINS.
LANDSCAPE LACKING PLANTS BECAUSE of LACK of WATER.
SLANTED PART of a LANDSCAPE.
ROCK LANDSCAPE that is INTENSELY AND STEEP AND CONTAINS WATER AT THE BOTTOM.
LANDSCAPE NOT IMAGINED as SURROUNDED BY SEA.
LANDSCAPE LACKING MOUNTAINS AND VALLEYS.
DWELL:inhabited TERRITORY NEAR a CITY.
PLACE at the END of a LONG THING.
SHARP TIP of an ARROW.
PLACE HIGH IN-RELATION-TO OTHER PLACE.
SMALL PLACE where MANY HUMANS, TYPICALLY PEASANTS, LIVE TOGETHER.
IN WHAT PLACE.
PLACE UNDER the SKY.[[WELT]]
PLACE in which one DWELLS, SURROUNDED BY WALLS, in a BUILDING.
ROOM USED FOR PRODUCING MEALS.
ROOM OR BUILDING for BATHING.
PLACE CONTAINING MANY SHOPS that are MUTUALLY CLOSE.
The PLACE where a RIVER OR BROOK BEGINS.
PLACE OR TIME at the SAME DISTANCE FROM BORDERS OR LIMITS SURROUNDING them, OR IN-RELATION-TO TWO SIDES.
MIDDLE of the NIGHT.
PLACE where one DWELLS ENDURINGLY OR ORIGINALLY.
PLACE AND TIME which CONTAINS ALL ABSTRACT AND CONCRETE THINGS.
PLACE NEAR to the SPEAKER.
FEATURE OF BEING HERE.
IN ALL PLACES.
PLACE NEAR a BORDER AND TYPICALLY INSIDE ONE STATE.
FROM HERE OR FROM THERE, DISTANT FROM one's SELF:own DWELLING.
PLACE where SHIPS CAN DROP ANCHOR AND are PROTECTED, AND where ONE CAN LEAVE SHIPS AND ENTER the SHORE.
UNDERWORLD in which SOULS SUFFER AFTER DEATH.
PLACE WHERE TWO OR MORE WAYS are LINKED.
ABSTRACT PLACE.
IN THAT PLACE.
PLACE LACKING LIGHT of SUN SURROUNDED BY PLACES WITH LIGHT OF SUN.
MOST HIGH PLACE in something.
TOP of MOUNTAIN.
FLACE FOR AFTERLIFE
UNDERWORLD in which SOULS SUFFER AFTER DEATH.
BASIC PART.
FORCE, PRINCIPLE, OR ELEMENT which CONTROLS PERCEIVED PHENOMENA in the WORLD.
BASIC ELEMENT which CONTROLS the DEVELOPMENT of an ANIMAL OR HUMAN from CONCEPTION ONWARDS.
SMALL MIXED PARTS.
ONE HUNDREDTH PART.
CONCRETE OBJECT.
SITUATION OR THING which CAUSES something TO HAPPEN OR to be TRUE.
SENTENCE-CONNECTIVE to the effect that S1 is the CAUSE:reason for S2 being TRUE. [GRAMMAR]
BECAUSE of WHAT? [GRAMMAR]
PRETENDED AND NOT REAL CAUSE for ACTING.
CAUSE which HAS EFFECTS IN FUTURE GENERATIONS.
INTENSELY LARGE THING on the SURFACE of which HUMANS AND ANIMALS LIVE.
THING which HAS the COMMON FEATURES of a certain CATEGORY.
EXAMPLE IMITATED OR EMULATED.
THINGS one POSSESSES.
IMPORTANT ENDURING PROPERTY.
PROPERTY TAKEN FROM an ENEMY in WAR, OR STOLEN.
BIG PROPERTY.
BIG MONEY PROPERTY.
VISIBLE THING IN the NIGHT SKY LACKING CLOUDS.
STAR INTENSELY NEAR TO, AND MOVING ROUND, the EARTH.
MOST BIG HOT STAR IN the SKY, CAUSING LIGHT on EARTH.
INTENSELY SHORT LIVED STAR.
STAR NAMES.
THING NOT SEPARATED into SEPARATE PARTS.
SUBSTANCE that REMAINS AFTER a THING is BURNT.
ASH CONTAINED in SMOKE, OR BLACK SUBSTANCE ON INSIDE WALLS CHIMNEYS.
SUBSTANCE USED by CREATURES.
FOOD USED to ENTICE:seduce AND CATCH FISH.
SPICY LIQUID PUT ON DRY FOOD.
LIQUID FOOD that CAN be said to be EATEN AND NOT ONLY DRUNK.
SOUP PRODUCED USING GRAIN AND WATER.
LIQUID FOOD CONTAINING ALCOHOL.
BAKED FOOD TYPICALLY CONTAINING YEAST AND EGGS.
FOOD PRODUCED USING FLOUR AND YEAST.
FOOD PRODUCED USING MILK CURD.
SUGARY FOOD SUBSTANCE PRODUCED by BEES. []
EXCELLENT SPECIAL FOOD.
SUBSTANCE ADDED to FOOD FOR CAUSING it to BECOME MORE SAVOURY.
INTENSELY COMMON SPICE ALSO USED FOR PRESERVING MEAT. []
LIQUID FOOD.
SUBSTANCE USED to CAUSE SURFACES TO BECOME INTENSELY SMOOTH AND TO RESEMBLE GLASS. []
HARD INTENSELY HEAVY SUBSTANCE OFTEN USED FOR PRODUCING ARTEFACTS, TOOLS, AND WEAPONS. []
METAL of COPPER AND TIN, SOMETIMES also WITH LEAD OR ZINK.
BRIGHT METAL [].
RED METAL USED in PRODUCING BRONZE. [Cu]
MOST EXPENSIVE SOFT METAL. []
COMMON METAL USED FOR MAKING TOOLS. []
MOST HEAVY METAL. [Pb]

COMMON METALS, USED FOR MAKING PLATES ETC. [CHEMISTRY] nearly approaching silver in whiteness and lustre, highly malleable and taking a high polish; used in the manufacture of articles of block tin, in the formation of alloys, as bronze, pewter, etc., and, on account of its resistance to oxidation, for making tin-plate and lining culinary and other iron vessels.
SUBSTANCE which CAN INTENSELY HARM HUMANS OR ANIMALS.
SUBSTANCE ON the EARTH in which PLANTS GROW.
INTENSELY MOIST SOIL.
MUD USED by POTTERS in PRODUCING VESSELS.
INTENSELY DRY SOIL in INTENSELY SMALL PIECES which CAN BE BLOWN at AND MOVED by WIND.
ROW of SOIL MOVED by a PLOUGH.
FINE SOIL on SEA SHORES. []
COMMON INTENSELY HARD SUBSTANCE in LANDSCAPE.
FLAT STONE USED FOR GRINDING.
STONE USED FOR CAUSING KNIVES TO BECOME MORE SHARP ON.
STONE PUT on a TOMB.
INTENSELY BIG STONE.
PATH ALONG a WAY.
VALUABLE SMALL STONE.
HARD BRIGHT STONE USED FOR PRODUCING ORNAMENTS. []
ABSTRACT SUBSTANCE which CONTAINS a FORCE.
SUBSTANCE OF the MAIN PART of TREES.
SMALL TIMBER USED FOR BURNING IN STOVES.
LONG, ROUND, STRAIGHT PIECE OF TIMBER.
STICK which has ROPES OR LEATHER RIBBONS ON THE TOP, USED FOR STRIKING HUMANS OR ANIMALS.
The large STICK or pole at the front of a carriage as a VEHICLE PART.
SMALL SHARP METAL STICK USED FOR FIXING THINGS on TIMBER ETC by CAUSING the STICK TO ENTER THE TIMBER ETC USING A HAMMER.
FLAT TIMBER.
LARGE TIMBER USED TO BUILD BUILDINGS.
VERTICAL BEAM OR RESEMBLING STONE USED TO KEEP SOMETHING LARGE AND HEAVY IN A HIGH PLACE.
BEAM ACROSS the FLOOR IN a GATE.
BIG BEAM USED in PRODUCING ROOFS.
LONG VERTICAL BEAM FOR HANGING SAILS on, IN the MIDDLE of a SHIP.
SUBSTANCE which is not MUSCLE AND CAUSES one to be FAT OR RESEMBLING SUBSTANCE PRODUCED USING ANIMALS OR PLANTS.
GREASE PRODUCED USING COW MILK AND USED AS FOOD.
SUBSTANCE USED FOR CURING OR PREVENTING DISEASES.
NOT LIQUID MEDICINE.
BLACK SUBSTANCE PRODUCED USING TIMBER, AND USED FOR BURNING.
SUBSTANCE of LARGE ELEPHANT TEETH USED FOR PRODUCING ORNAMENTS.
HEAVY REDDISH MINERAL SUBSTANCE the most important ore of mercury.
DISCARDED SUBSTANCE OR THING.
RUBBISH which SINKS to the BOTTOM of LIQUIDS RESEMBLING WINE ETC..
WHITE SOFT SUBSTANCE RESEMBLING WOOL.
COMMON HARD SUBSTANCE one CAN LOOK THROUGH which is OFTEN USED FOR WINDOWS.
SUBSTANCE consisting of what is excreted by humans of animals in defecation.
EXCREMENT USED FOR FERTILISING.
A LIQUID which does NOT FREEZE, BURNS, AND does NOT MIX WITH WATER. []
OIL USED FOR CAUSING SKIN TO BECOME SMOOTH.
AIRY SUBSTANCE CAUSED-TO RISE by FIRE.
A SUBSTANCE USED FOR REMOVING DIRT WHEN WASHING.
INTENSELY COMMON SWEET SUBSTANCE OFTEN USED IN COOKING. [CHEMISTRY]
The PLANT SUBSTANCE one BURNS AND SUCKS the SMOKE of FOR ENJOYMENT.
SUBSTANCE which CAN FLOW.
IMPORTANT LIQUID in the BODY.
BODY JUICE ISSUED FROM the BODY WHEN it is HOT, OR WHEN IT USES MUCH STRENGTH.
BODY JUICE in the form of SALTY WATER TYPICALLY ISSUING from the EYES WHEN one FEELS INTENSE GRIEF OR SADNESS.
BODY JUICE which FLOWS in the VEINS AND SUPPORTS LIFE.
LIQUID IN the NOSE.
MALE BODY JUICE which CAUSES WOMEN TO BECOME PREGNANT.
WATER in the MOUTH of HUMANS AND ANIMALS.
LIQUID DEVELOPED IN the BREAST of FEMALES, which CAN NOURISH their CHILDREN.
COVERED by or MIXED with LIQUID, TYPICALLY with WATER.
CAUSE TO BECOME MOIST.
INTENSELY COMMON TRANSPARENT LIQUID LACKING TASTE which FILLS RIVERS AND the SEA.
WATER CONTAINING INTENSELY MANY:much SALT.
VISIBLE MASS of ASSEMBLED WATER OR ICE FLOATING IN the AIR.
INTENSELY LOW CLOUD on the SURFACE of the EARTH.
BRIGHT CLOUD AROUND SUN OR MOON.
WATER from the AIR on COOL SURFACES, TYPICALLY VISIBLE in the MORNINGS.
HARD FROZEN WATER.
SNOW which has BECOME ICE SPHERES.
INTENSELY BIG ACCUMULATION OF WATER IN a LANDSCAPE.
SMALL LAKE PRODUCED by HUMANS.
INTENSELY SMALL POND.
WATER FALLING FROM CLOUDS.
MUCH ASSEMBLED FLOWING WATER as PART OF LANDSCAPE.
Individual RIVER.
SMALL RIVER IN VALLEY.
ARTEFACT:artificial RIVER.
CANAL PRODUCED FOR DEFENDING A CITY.
ABUNDANT SALTY WATER SURROUNDING LAND.
WHITE FROZEN RAIN.
SNOW which has BECOME ICE SPHERES.
MOVING WATER RESEMBLING MOUNTAIN RIDGE.
TYPICALLY BLACK LIQUID one USES TO WRITE OR PAINT with.
LIQUID FOR DRINKING PRODUCED USING HOT WATER AND LEAVES. []
SMALL SPHERE OF LIQUID.
COMMON SOUR LIQUID SPICE.
LIQUID PRODUCED USING FRUIT, USED FOR DRINKING.
A SUBSTANCE USED FOR CAUSING THINGS to be INTENSELY LINKED.
SUBSTANCE USED FOR PRODUCING BEAUTIFUL ODOURS.
SUBSTANCE IN which THINGS CAN FLOAT AND FLY BUT NOT SWIM.
GAS which FILLS SPACE ON EARTH.
AIR in STRONG MOTION.*Wind from a direction X. [Why so rarely the direction towards which the wind is moving?]
INTENSE WIND.
STORM ACCOMPANIED BY SNOW.
IMPORTANT NOT LIQUID SUBSTANCES IN THE BODY.
INTENSELY HARD BODY TISSUE.
SEQUENCE OF BONES FROM NECK TO ABDOMEN AND THE BODY PART SURROUNDING IT.
BIG BONES at FRONT of CHEST.
BONE in FISH.
MUSCLES AND SINEWS of a ANIMAL OR HUMAN.
FLESH of DEAD ANIMALS USED as FOOD.
MEAT that has been CUT into SMALL PARTS.
MEAT that has been CAUSED TO BECOME DRY.
MEAT USED IN SACRIFICE.
MEAT that has been CAUSED NOT TO ROT USING SALT AND LIQUIDS.
FINELY CUT MEAT WRAPPED IN INTESTINE ETC..
BODY-TISSUE which GROWS on SKIN, VISIBLY on the TOP of the HEAD of HUMANS, and OTHER PLACES.
HAIR ON FACE.
HAIR ON the SKIN of ANIMALS.
FUR HAVING LONG HAIR ON the NECK of a HORSE.
METHOD of FIXING HAIR and HEADGEAR.
HAIR ABOVE the EYES.
HAIR of the FUR of OVINES ETC. USED FOR PRODUCING GARMENTS.
HAIR on the SIDE of the UPPER PART of the HEAD.
HAIR BEAUTIFULLY ARRANGED ON HEAD.
LONG BONES GROWING ON the HEADS of BOVINES AND OVINES ETC.
The COMPLEX BODY TISSUE which WRAPS the WHOLE BODY of HUMANS AND ANIMALS.
SKIN, LACKING FUR, of ANIMALS OFTEN USED to PRODUCE ARTEFACTS.
SKIN MOVING on the EYE.
STRONG BODY TISSUE LINKING MUSCLES to BONES.
SOFT BODY TISSUE INSIDE THE HEAD.
THING PRODUCED by MAN.
BIG ARTEFACT PRODUCED FOR HUMANS OR ANIMALS to DWELL in OR BE-IN, or MOVE ON.
ARTIFACT BUILT FOR:in order to CAUSE HUMANS to be ABLE to CROSS TYPICALLY a RIVER OR a VALLEY.
BUILDING OR social INSTITUTION in which PUBLIC DUTIES are ACTED:performed BY OFFICIALS.
MOST HIGH BURAUCRATIC OFFICE which GOVERNS a STATE.
SMALL BUILDING PRODUCED FOR RESTING AND FEASTS.
BUILDING OR BUILDINGS that have been COMPLETELY DESTROYED.
INSTITUTION OR BUILDING USED FOR TEACHING.
SCHOOL FOR ADULT STUDENTS.
STATE INSTITUTION OR SCHOOL FOR EXCELLENT SCHOLARS.
BUILDING USED FOR REARING DOMESTIC ANIMALS.
BUILDING USED FOR KEEPING USEFUL THINGS.
STOREHOUSE FOR DOCUMENTS
BUILDING USED FOR WORSHIP of DEITIES.
TYPICALLY SMALL BUILDING PRODUCED USING CLOTH AND TIMBER.
PLACE OR BUILDING which SHOWS where one has BURIED a HUMAN.
SMALL BUILDING USED FOR FETCHING WATER FROM DEEP INSIDE THE EARTH.
ROOM or BUILDING USED FOR DEFECATION.
BUILDING PRODUCED so as to PERMIT HUMANS to DWELL in it.
SMALL DWELLING.
DWELLING FOR MONKS. See TEMPLE
BUILDING USED by OFFICIALS FOR WORK.
PUBLIC-BUILDING in which the RULER ACTS:conducts GOVERNMENT. See also LAWCOURT.
PUBLIC BUILDING IN which CONVICTED GUILTY HUMANS ARE CONDEMNED to DWELL, AND which they are NOT PERMITTED TO LEAVE.
PUBLIC BUILDING FOR GUESTS.
PUBLIC BUILDING USED FOR the ADMINISTRATION of LITIGATION.
BIG PUBLIC-BUILDING USED as a DWELLING by a RULER OR an ARISTOCRAT.
BUILDING PRODUCED OR USED FOR CURING HUMANS who have ILLNESSES.
PUBLIC BUILDING that is PART of a MONASTERY.
BUILDING PRODUCED OR USED FOR PERMITTING GUESTS OR STRANGERS TO DWELL in it DURING a SHORT PERIOD.
BUILDING which is MUCH HIGHER THAN BROAD.
BUILDING USED TO PRODUCE THINGS.
INTENSELY FORTIFIED BUILDING.
BUILDING PRODUCED FOR GRINDING GRAIN.
BUILDING IN which one SELLS.
SHOP where BOOKS are SOLD.
SHOP WHICH SELLS DRUGS.
SHOP WHICH SELLS MEALS to be EATEN in the SHOP.
BUILDING FOR PRODUCING INTENSELY MANY of the SAME ARTEFACTS.
SYSTEM OF FACTORIES PRODUCING MANY of the SAME of ARTEFACTS.
SMALL TOWER OR PART of a BUILDING INTENSELY MORE HIGH than the OTHER PART of the BUILDING.
PUBLIC-BUILDING USED TO SHOW TYPICALLY OLD OR RARE THINGS.
ARTEFACT PRODUCED FOR CONTAINING WRITING.
LIST of the DAYS of the YEAR.
DOCUMENT of INTENSELY BIG AUTHORITY, TYPICALLY USED in EDUCATION.
PRIVATE DOCUMENT FOR SENDING TO, and ADDRESSING, someone.
PUBLIC LETTER ADDRESSED to a RULER.
EMPTY DOCUMENT.
DOCUMENT of MANY PAGES TIED TOGETHER.
DOCUMENT JUXTAPOSES NAMES of THINGS.
LIST OF ANCESTORS.
DOCUMENT which SYSTEMATICALLY EXPLAINS the WORDS of a LANGUAGE.
DOCUMENT CREATED as ART OR BELIEVED to BE ART.
LITERATURE DESCRIBING IMAGINED EVENTS that are NOT REAL.
FICTION STORY EXPLAINING BASIC FEATURES of a CULTURE OR CIVILISATION.
TRADITIONAL FICTION ABOUT HEROES AND DEITIES.
LITERATURE which is RHYMED OR which is LIKE RHYMED LITERATURE.
DOCUMENT which SYSTEMATICALLY EXPLAINS the MEANING of ANOTHER DOCUMENT.
BIG DOCUMENT CONTAINING MANY CHAPTERS.
BOOK which TRIES to COLLECT SYSTEMATICALLY ALL BASIC KNOWLEDGE.
PUBLIC PRINTED DOCUMENT PUBLISHED ALL:every DAY, WEEK, OR MONTH.
DOCUMENT WRITTEN IN SHORT LINES, TYPICALLY of REGULAR RHYTHM AND HAVING RHYME.
INTENSELY BIG REPORTING>NARRATIVE POEM.
POEM SUNG CONFORMING to a MELODY.
DOCUMENT DESCRIBING THE LIFE OF A HUMAN.
BIOGRAPHY OF ONESELF
DOCUMENT AT THE BEGINNING OR END OF A BOOK, EXPLAINING ITS WRITING.
DOCUMENT BELONGING TO A CULTURALLY DEFINED TYPE AND STYLE.
TIMBER ARTEFACT which SHOWS the BOUNDARY of a TYPICALLY SMALL TERRITORY and HINDERS OTHERS from ENTERING that TERRITORY.
CLOTH ARTEFACT WORN by HUMANS IN ORDER TO CAUSE THEMSELVES TO FEEL COMFORTABLE.
GARMENT one WEARS on the HEAD.
HAT one WEARS FOR PROTECTION AGAINST RAIN.
HAT in the form of a CLOTH TIED AROUND the HEAD.
RITUAL HAT worn by OFFICIAL.
RITUAL ORNAMENT WORN ON THE HEAD
STRIP of CLOTH OR LEATHER USED to TIE ROUND one's WAIST.
BELT USED on HORSES.
GARMENT WORN on the FEET.
FOOTWEAR WORN INSIDE SHOES.
GARMENTS WORN UNDER OTHER GARMENTS.
UNDERWEAR WORN by WOMEN.
GARMENT APPROPRIATE to be WORN at COURT.
HEAVY OUTER GARMENT FOR PROTECTION AGAINST RAIN AND COLD.
COAT one WEARS FOR PROTECTION AGAINST RAIN.
GARMENT WORN OVER STOMACH AND LEGS.
OUTER GARMENET FOR THE UPPER PART of the BODY.
GARMENT WORN on the STOMACH AND HANGING LOOSELY on the SIDES.
GARMENT USED in MOURNING.
OUTSIDE GARMENT to PROTECT the FRONT of one's LOWER GARMENTS.
GARMENT one WEARS on one's HANDS.
THIN GARMENT WORN on the UPPER PART of the BODY.
GARMENT one WEARS WHILE SLEEPING.
COMMON GARMENT WORN BY SOLDIERS, SHOWING RANK.
FLAT ARTEFACT PRODUCED FOR CAUSING one to be ABLE SEE ONESELF in it.
STANDARD SYSTEM of ARTEFACTS, PRODUCED CONFORMING to a LAW, AND USED EVERYWHERE IN A SOCIETY, CONFORMING to DEFINED RULES, to EXCHANGE ALL OTHER THINGS for.
MONEY GIVEN to someone who WORKS for his/her WORK.
MONEY used for a certain purpose.
MONEY one MUST GIVE to BUY something.
PRICE MORE SMALL THAN IMAGINED.
INTENSELY CHEAP so as NOT REQUIRING MONEY to be GIVEN or RECEIVED.
PRICE MORE BIG IN-RELATION-TO the PRICE IMAGINED.
MONEY CONFISCATED FROM CITIZENS by the OFFICIALS of the GOVERNMENT, CONFORMING to a LAW.
RITUAL TAXES PAID REGULARLY to a RULER by his DISTANT SUBJECTS.
MONEY OWED.
TOOLS USED FOR PRODUCING MUSIC.
METAL MUSICAL-INSTRUMENT RESEMBLE:like a BIG CUP which one CAUSES-TO PRODUCE SOUND by BEATING it USING a STICK.

[[A MUSICAL INSTRUMENT of the percussive class, consisting of a hollow cylindrical or hemispherical frame of wood or metal, with a head of tightly stretched membrane at one or both ends, by the striking of which and the resonance of the cavity the sound is produced.]]
MUSICAL INSTRUMENTS PRODUCED USING STONE.
MUSICAL INSTRUMENT which has STRINGS.
TIMBER OR CLAY MUSICAL INSTRUMENT RESEMBLING A TUBE which one BLOWS into FOR PRODUCING SOUND.
MUSICAL INSTRUMENT CONTAINING MANY TUBES, AND BLOWN into USING the MOUTH.
ARTEFACT of TIED THREADS, CONTAINING MANY BIG HOLES BETWEEN the THREADS.
ARTEFACT on a FLAT SURFACE OFTEN:typically INTENDED to DEPICT or to COMMUNICATE something.
PICTURE of DEITY.
ABSTRACT PICTURE of TERRITORY.
MENTAL PICTURE CAUSED QUICKLY BY PERCEPTION OR THOUGHT.
PICTURE which MOCKS.
PICTURE BY SOMEONE OF HIMSELF
PICTURE:diagram OF THE UNIVERSE
ARTEFACT USED FOR REFERRING to something INTENSELY DIFFERENT from that ARTEFACT.
WRITTEN IMAGE:symbol TYPICALLY USED to RECORD SPEAK:speech.
OFFICIAL IMAGE:symbol SHOWING one's RANK OR JOB.
SYMBOL USED TO PROVE OFFICIAL AUTHORITY of a DOCUMENT by PRODUCING a MARK on that DOCUMENT.
SYMBOL PUT in a PLACE FOR EXPRESSING a COMMAND OR ADVICE.
IMAGE SHOWING OR PROVING that a FUTURE EVENT will HAPPEN.
IMAGE PRODUCED USING STONE, TIMBER, OR METAL.
IMAGE CONTAINING SIX HORIZONTAL STROKES USED in DIVINATION.
IMAGE:symbol NOT REFERRING to ONE OBJECT BUT SHOWING RELATIONS of SAME REFERENCE.
IMAGE:sign IN a PLACE of something that in the PAST has BE-IN:been in THIS PLACE.
TRACE of CURED INJURY.
TRACE PRODUCED by a FOOT ON a SURFACE.
TRACE MADE by the WHEELS of VEHICLES IN ROADS.
SYMBOL USED IN WRITING TO REFER-TO SINGLE SOUNDS
MAGIC SYMBOL CARRIED BY HUMANS IN ORDER TO DEFEND ONESELF AGAINST EVIL.
SYMBOL of WINNING in COMPETITION
WRITTEN SYMBOL FOR A SOUND
SMALL ARTEFACT one TRIES to SHOOT INTO in ARCHERY ETC..
INTENSELY LONG THIN ARTEFACT PRODUCED USING COTTON, WOOL, SILK ETC, TYPICALLY USED FOR SEWING OR TYING UP THINGS ETC..
INTENSELY BIG AND STRONG THREAD.
ROPES USED TO STEER HORSES.
THREADS OR ROPES PUT TOGETHER so as to CAUSE it TO be DIFFICULT to MUTUALLY REMOVE them from each other.
THICK THREAD.
A THREAD WHICH one MOVES WHEN PLAYING a STRING INSTRUMENT.
METAL STRING PRODUCED USING LINKED RINGS.
ARTEFACT USED FOR PLAYING with.
PERFECTLY ROUND THING that CAN BE MOVED.
BALL CONTAINING AIR OR GAS AND HAVING an INTENSELY THIN SKIN which is EASY to DESTROY.
SMALL SHINING BALL which GROWS IN MUSSELS.
TOY in the form of a SMALL STATUE of a HUMAN.
ARTEFACT USED TO COOK OR CAUSE ROOMS to BECOME WARM.
ARTEFACT TYPICALLY PRODUCED by WEAVING OR KNITTING, SOMETIMES USED FOR PRODUCING GARMENTS.
BIG CLOTH USED to SAFEGUARD SLEEPING HUMANS AGAINST the COLD WHILE they SLEEP.
A BLANKET FOR PUTTING ON the FLOOR.
MAT PRODUCED USING BAMBOO.
MAT PRODUCED USING STRAW OR REEDS.
MAT PRODUCED USING WOOL.
HANGING CLOTH USED FOR BLOCKING OR CONCEALING something.
VEHICLE PART in the form of a CURTAIN which blocks the view inside the carriage.
INTENSELY SMALL LONG AND NARROW CLOTH.
CLOTH PRODUCED USING SILK THREADS.
EMBROIDERED SILK CLOTH.

DISTRESS ARISING from BAD THOUGHTS NOW IN ONE'S MIND which CAUSE one to LACK DELIGHT:joy.NB: The words I have chosen to include in this group pose special problems of contrastive analysis. There is something irretrievably diffuse about their usage, in many cases, and in many others the number of relevant examples in the early literature is so small that it is impossible to get anything like a firm grip on their precise semantics. Under these circumstances I have tried to compensate for lack of neat analysis with more quotation, especially from Chǔcí. Throughout this section I quote my teacher David Hawkes' translations, mindful of the fact that many of these were written in the third year of his study of Chinese...

revisionDesc.change:
Compiled the taxonomy, split into the following trees:
A major tree, emanating from the concept PRIME
A 'garbage' tree, starting with N/A, collecting all items that are explicitly linking here
A separate tree of items that where empirically not linked in the above two trees, thus a collection of islands, starting at Not def. Due to these problems, some concepts appear more than one time in the taxonomy. In these cases, the one appearing first in the file has been chosen as the temporary stand-in, with the other versions instead getting a @corresp attribute that points to the first instance. It might be useful at some point to go over them and choose the right ones.
Added def to the taxonomy, compiled freshly at this occasion.
Changed many more entries from xml:id to @corresp, all xml:ids should be unique now.
Added a new xml:id for the entries that got changed to @corresp, so that I can address them.
